general_advisory: As per the extended range forecast (date: 16.01.2025) of IMD, MC, Bhubaneswar, dry weather along with normal to below normal minimum temperature is expected over the districts of Odisha during week-1 (17th to 23rd January, 2025) and week-2 (24th to 30th January, 2025). Farmers are advised to take necessary precautions to protect crops and animals from cold weather conditions.

advisory: To control weeds in nursery, farmers should spray Pyrazosulfuron-ethyl 10% WP @ 80 g/acre at 3-5 days after sowing (DAS) or Bispyribac sodium @ 120 ml/acre at 10-12 DAS (or at 2-3 leaf stage of weeds) in 140 liters of water.
If seedling blight is noticed, spray Carbendazim @ 400 g/acre or Propiconazole @ 200 g/acre in 200 liters of water.

Transplant 3-5 week old seedlings advised in well puddled soil at a spacing of 15 cm x 15 cm with 3-4 seedlings per hill at a shallow depth. Apply (DAP 44 kg + MOP 22 kg) or (Urea 22 kg + SSP 125 kg + MOP 22 kg) as basal dose during final puddling.
Regular monitoring for Aphid attack in mustard. Use Acetamiprid @ 125g per 500 liters of water per hectare or Imidachloprid @ 0.5 ml per liter of water under dry weather conditions.
Avoid insecticide application at initial flowering stage.
Wrap or fix polythene/alkathane sheet tightly on mango trees to manage mango mealy bug.
Training and pruning of diseased and unwanted branches and leaves advised.
Use straw as mulching material to maintain soil moisture and temperature.
Harvest mature crops and provide light irrigation in vegetative growth stage due to expected dry weather.
Cover animal shelter from all sides during night to avoid exposure to cold winds.
Cover weak and sick animals with sack cloth for protection from cold.
Do not keep animals in damp areas to prevent pneumonia. Protect animals from smoke as well.
Feed animals a mixture of oil cakes and jiggery for maintaining body temperature, especially pregnant animals.
